We were in town visiting family who live in the neighborhood. Our request was some delicious pizza while in town. And boy did Swiss Slice deliver! We had very friendly service and the staff patiently explained the pizzas and toppings available. The pizza was delicious; the crust was great, and the sauce was perfect.  We enjoyed the fun atmosphere for and were very happy with our visit. We will definitely return next time in town.

This place quietly became a staple in our neighborhood. Well located near a busy intersection on Nostrand ave. Their open concept with the two doors adds a lot of appeal to the place. You can easily walk in, inspect the various pizzas and chose what you want. The margharita slice is my go to, very cheesy, sweet tomato sauce, not too soggy. I have also been tempted to try their new flavors, more recently the sausage pepperoni ,red onions and peppers combo. Very tasty. They have added late hours which is great since a lot of other places are dead past 10pm. Above all, the service is amazing. The staff and owner are always cheerful and insightful on the menu. Definitely a  favorite local spot!

Swiss Slice is one of the closer pizza joints near my house and I must say I‚Äôm impressed with their menu, they offer an array of different pizzas and I love that I can walk in and see a pizza combination I‚Äôve never seen before, so definite point's for experimenting with flavors üôåüèΩ Overall quality ingredients, fresh slices and very warm and friendly staff especially the owner! Nothing here to complain about folks.
Great pizza and staff

Average slice of pizza. This is NYC I know a handful of shops that have bigger slices made with more ingredients at the same price. Gino‚Äôs specifically on Flatbush & Lincoln Rd! Less than a mile away. No air conditioning on 80 degree day.
Very good food here every day after school

Very low to mid pizza at best. Expensive for what you get. $5 pepperoni slice and $3 plain, plus tax on top of that.

Sauce is too sweet, dough is not seasoned, I don't think they have the rise on the pizza correct because it's quite bloating.

They should try to perfect the plain and pepperoni before making all of these other random slices.

I tried them when they first opened and again now, still the same low quality. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend.

I have been eating here for about a year and while at first it was ok (I‚Äôm a native NYer) I have noticed they have gotten better and better. They are adding new flavors like burrata or new type of pepperoni or something because the quality change is noticeable. The guys there seem to really be proud of their pies :) I like coming here more and more.

Update- oops! I gave them 4 :) they are a 5
It‚Äôs fair. The pizza is not bad. It‚Äôs not great. The service is really good though so they have that going for it. The pizza needs more sauce.
The margarita pie is soooo good!

Very tasty pizza pies and slices! My son is a big fan üòé Also cold beverages, garlic bread. You can eat there (loud music). Kind men. Highly recommended if you're visiting Brooklyn near Church Avenue.

I rate them high because the people working there are warm and friendly. The service is always good. I come s few times a month because I work near by, though this is my first time providing a review. They also offer inside and outside seating.
That best pizza

Almost 9$ for a slice.. the slice was decent. Airy dough but no flavor. Good tomato sauce.. charging that cost while having low quality dough is absolutely insane. If you want quality pizza opt for Luigi‚Äôs or Di fara. They‚Äôre both cheaper and miles miles better.
The pizza is delicious and the service is even better! Always a smile and fun atmosphere. These guys are doing it right. My go to spot

The pizza was absolutely delicious. They delivered to my apartment promptly and it arrived hot. I had a large supreme pie, pepperoni pie and margarita pie. The pizza was crisp and sauce was impeccable. Easily best NY pizza I have had! The service was 2nd to none the owner and staff were extremely warm and kind over the phone. They were patient and suggested items on their menu. I would recommend anyone to dine here. All around amazing experience!

Let's dive into the realm of mouthwatering pizza slices and the vibrant borough of Brooklyn. As a devoted enthusiast, one of my top recommendations is Swiss slices, a culinary gem nestled in the bustling streets of New York City.

During my recent escapade to Brooklyn, I indulged in a slice of their heavenly margarita pepperoni pizza. The cheese melted delicately in my mouth, while the flavors harmonized in a symphony of satisfaction. Additionally, I couldn't resist the temptation of their saucy buffalo chicken slice, which left my taste buds in awe.

What sets Swiss slices apart is their diverse range of options. Whether you're a vegan seeking culinary bliss or a meat lover in pursuit of the perfect slice, they have something for everyone. But their expertise goes beyond pizza alone. Prepare to be captivated by their tantalizing pasta dishes, delectable Italian sausage, and an array of bread options that will transport you straight to Italy.

Before you embark on your own culinary adventure, be sure to look up Swiss slices and let them know that Marie sent you. Trust me, you won't regret it.

I had the great pleasure to come across this new pizza place in my neighborhood. Marco and his business partner are lovely and we chatted for a bit too. Since I am vegetarian, I ordered a margarita pie with fresh mushrooms on one half. It‚Ä¶

This is the best pizza I‚Äôve had. Not only in New York but ever. Fast service, great variety of flavors, amazing prices and the owners are amazing. If you‚Äôre in the Brooklyn area or anywhere near you have to come get a slice or an entire pie.
I loved the Swiss Slice thin crust pizza. And their wings were delicious too.

Some of the best deep dish pepperoni pizza I've ever experienced!

This place has a really amazing variety of pizza by the slice and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The decor is very modern and hip as well,  I definitely recommend The Swiss Slice!

I pass by this pizza place often and have been meaning to go. I finally made the quick trip and bought 2 slices from them (cheese and pepperoni). It‚Äôs perplexing how these pizzas got such positive reviews since they were very mediocre and overpriced for their quality. I figured since this was a local establishment away from touristic spots, the prices would be more modest, but honestly paying over seven dollars for 2 very subpar slices in Flatbush just didn‚Äôt sit right with me. I‚Äôm okay with paying more for good quality, but these pizzas don‚Äôt have the quality & flavor to back up their price.
The staff was pretty friendly though, so that‚Äôs nice.

Unfortunately, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone.
There are better quality pizzas nearby for less cost.

I got there super late only tried Beef patty . I didnt love it . If I'm ever over there again I would definitely try pizza they had variety.  I just had pizza earlier that day that's why I order beef patty .

I had a disappointing experience today‚ÄîAfter agreeing to buy a slice for a homeless individual, I was over-charged double for just his. I won't be returning after this.
---
Edit, in reply to Owner:

Thank you for your response, but I find it inappropriate and immature. My main concern was being overcharged, which left me feeling frustrated and taken advantage of. While I appreciate your supposed commitment to supporting homeless individuals, your reply doesn‚Äôt address the issue at hand. I expected a more professional response to my experience.
